Class Bear

  • java.lang.Object
    • Animal
      • Bear
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Actor

    public class Bear
extends Animal
    A simple model of a Bear. Bears age, move, eat rabbits, and die.
    Version:
    2011.07.31
    Author:
    David J. Barnes and Michael Kölling

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bear

        public Bear(boolean randomAge,
    Field field,
    Location location)
        Create a Bear. A Bear can be created as a new born (age zero and not hungry) or with a random age and food level.
        Parameters:
        randomAge - If true, the Bear will have random age and hunger level.
        field - The field currently occupied.
        location - The location within the field.

    • Method Detail

      • giveBirth

        public void giveBirth(java.util.List<Actor> newBears)
        Check whether or not this rabbit is to give birth at this step. New births will be made into free adjacent locations.
        Parameters:
        newRabbits - A list to return newly born rabbits.

      • act

        public void act(java.util.List<Actor> newBears)
        This is what the Bear does most of the time: it hunts for rabbits. In the process, it might breed, die of hunger, or die of old age.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Actor
        Specified by:
        act in class Animal
        Parameters:
        field - The field currently occupied.
        newBeares - A list to return newly born Bears.
